item.description:
Please RSVP! Space is limited!

We will be meeting in E51-372

Feature Talk: April 25, 2007

The Evolution of Relative Strength Investing: From the Red Books of Securities Research to Cabot Top Ten
presented by Timothy Lutts, President of Cabot Heritage Corporation

Timothy will present from the following outline:

* Why momentum investing works - it's perception, not earnings
* The formula used in Cabot Top Ten
* Most valuable fundamental factors
* Setting buy ranges
* The Worst Sell Rule
* The Best Sell Rule


Timothy will pack as much in as he can. He promises it will be very timely - featuring stocks that are interesting at the time. He will also bring samples of his firm's five newsletter publications that all attendees who wish can take home.


Bio of Timothy Lutts
Timothy is president of Cabot Heritage Corporation, an independent publisher of investment advice for both individual and professional investors. He was a part-time, underpaid employee at the firm's beginning in 1970, and joined his father in the business full-time in 1986 as editor of a newsletter on mutual funds. Today Cabot publishes five newsletters using a variety of investment strategies, but the company's DNA is built on momentum investing.


Cabot Heritage Corporation
Publishers of:
Cabot Market Letter
Cabot Top Ten Report
Cabot China & Emerging Markets Report
Cabot Benjamin Graham Value Letter
Cabot Stock of the Month Report
Cabot Wealth Advisory


http://www.cabot.net...
http://www.cabotwealt...


176 North St
Salem , MA 01970


(978) 745-5532


The agenda for the meetup will be:
7:00 Fred Sears's Q&A, a Market Discussion led by Doug and then Stockpicks led by Mike Kinkead and Chris Jones
8:00 Timothy Lutts feature presentation (described above)

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required.
item.name: The Boston Investor's Business Daily April Meetup
